snippet: Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve’s No. 2 official, would become the first woman to lead the Federal Reserve, and the first Democrat to get the job since 1987.
abstract: Pres Obama will nominate Janet L Yellen as chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, ending an unusually prolonged and public search to fill one of the most important economic policy-making jobs in the world; Yellen, who has been Fed's vice chairwoman since 2010, will be first woman to run the central bank and the first Democrat to get the job since 1987.

byline.contributor: Binyamin Appelbaum, Annie Lowrey and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve’s No. 2 official, would become the first woman to lead the Federal Reserve, and the first Democrat to get the job since 1987.

headline.main: Obama to Pick Yellen as Leader of Fed, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Yellen Said To Be Obama's Nominee To Lead The Fed
